basic.floral_language:
Jasminum nudiflorum
Floriography: vernal, strong and firm, beautiful.
Jasminum nudiflorum is one of the “four snow friends” which flower in winter. It is the official flower of Hebi city.
The plant is a deciduous shrub with slender branches which could be easily shaped freely. Flower blooms before leave shoots, slightly fragrant, five to six petals. Leaves are green, round oval.
Jasminum nudiflorum requires plenty of sunlight. It is partial shade tolerant. Direct bright sunlight should be avoided in hot summer. Flower blooms in March to June for three to four weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-June, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, slight shade tolerance, in summer use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
